title: The Aftermath of a YouTube Apology
description: Quantifying the lasting impact of a YouTube controversy.

slides.text: When YouTuber apology videos inspired Halloween costumes, we knew it was time to investigate.
All sorts of celebrities have controversies that end with public apologies. But few have to shit where they eat — so to speak — like YouTubers. Plus, thereâ€™s data ðŸ¤“.
We researched nearly every possible popular YouTuber with a documented controversy in the past few years and found 31* with apology videos.
TLDR; There is a wide range of impact following an apology video. And <mark>beauty YouTubers</mark> have a large share of the shame pie.
The best we can do to measure the impact is to look at their subscriber base reaction. Step one: look at their pre-controversy growth. Where were they headed?
Most people are growing. Some are stable, a couple are losing subscribers.
Step two: Fast forward to their post-apology subscriber change to see what happened. We skipped the period in between because it ranged from one day to a year since each controversy was different
Wide variety of results here. To make better sense of the trends, we grouped them to find similar patterns. Applying the k-means clustering algorithm, we get a few distinct groups.
